memberdef.argsstring: (Container &c)
memberdef.name: inserter

briefdescription.para: Insert iterator generator.

detaileddescription.para: Returns insert iterator capable to insert values to the container (spatial index) which has member function insert(value_type const&) defined.

parameterdescription.para: The reference to the container (spatial index) to which values will be inserted.

simplesect.para: The insert iterator inserting values to the container.

memberdef.argsstring: (Geometry const &g)
memberdef.name: contains

briefdescription.para: Generate contains() predicate.

detaileddescription.para: Generate a predicate defining Value and Geometry relationship. Value will be returned by the query if bg::within(Geometry, Indexable) returns true.

memberdef.argsstring: (Geometry const &g)
memberdef.name: covered_by

briefdescription.para: Generate covered_by() predicate.

detaileddescription.para: Generate a predicate defining Value and Geometry relationship. Value will be returned by the query if bg::covered_by(Indexable, Geometry) returns true.

detaileddescription.para: Generate a predicate defining Value and Geometry relationship. Value will be returned by the query if bg::within(Indexable, Geometry) returns true.

memberdef.argsstring: (UnaryPredicate const &pred)
memberdef.name: satisfies

briefdescription.para: Generate satisfies() predicate.

detaileddescription.para: A wrapper around user-defined UnaryPredicate checking if Value should be returned by spatial query.

parameterdescription.para: A type of unary predicate function or function object.
The unary predicate function or function object.

memberdef.argsstring: (Geometry const &geometry, unsigned k)
memberdef.name: nearest

briefdescription.para: Generate nearest() predicate.

detaileddescription.para: When nearest predicate is passed to the query, k-nearest neighbour search will be performed. nearest() predicate takes a Geometry from which distances to Values are calculated and the maximum number of Values that should be returned. Internally boost::geometry::comparable_distance() is used to perform the calculation.

simplesect.para: Only one nearest() predicate may be used in a query.

parameterdescription.para: The geometry from which distance is calculated.
The maximum number of values to return.

detaileddescription.para: It calls rtree::insert(value_type const&).

parameterdescription.para: The value which will be stored in the index.

memberdef.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::size_type
memberdef.definition: rtree<Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator>::size_type boost::geometry::index::remove
memberdef.argsstring: (rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > &tree, Value const &v)
memberdef.name: remove

param.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > &

briefdescription.para: Remove a value from the container.

detaileddescription.para: Remove a value from the container. In contrast to the std::set or std::map erase() method this function removes only one value from the container.
It calls rtree::remove(value_type const&).

parameterdescription.para: The value which will be removed from the index.

simplesect.para: 1 if value was removed, 0 otherwise.

memberdef.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::size_type
memberdef.definition: rtree<Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator>::size_type boost::geometry::index::remove
memberdef.argsstring: (rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > &tree, Iterator first, Iterator last)
memberdef.name: remove

param.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > &

briefdescription.para: Remove a range of values from the container.

detaileddescription.para: Remove a range of values from the container. In contrast to the std::set or std::map erase() method it doesn't take iterators pointing to values stored in this container. It removes values equal to these passed as a range. Furthermore this function removes only one value for each one passed in the range, not all equal values.
It calls rtree::remove(Iterator, Iterator).

parameterdescription.para: The beginning of the range of values.
The end of the range of values.

simplesect.para: The number of removed values.

memberdef.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::size_type
memberdef.definition: rtree<Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator>::size_type boost::geometry::index::remove
memberdef.argsstring: (rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > &tree, ConvertibleOrRange const &conv_or_rng)
memberdef.name: remove

param.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > &

briefdescription.para: Remove a value corresponding to an object convertible to it or a range of values from the container.

detaileddescription.para: Remove a value corresponding to an object convertible to it or a range of values from the container. In contrast to the std::set or std::map erase() method it removes values equal to these passed as a range. Furthermore this method removes only one value for each one passed in the range, not all equal values.
It calls rtree::remove(ConvertibleOrRange const&).

parameterdescription.para: The object of type convertible to value_type or the range of values.

simplesect.para: The number of removed values.

memberdef.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::size_type
memberdef.definition: rtree<Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator>::size_type boost::geometry::index::query
memberdef.argsstring: (rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > const &tree, Predicates const &predicates, OutIter out_it)
memberdef.name: query

param.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > const &

briefdescription.para: Finds values meeting passed predicates e.g. nearest to some Point and/or intersecting some Box.

detaileddescription.para: This query function performs spatial and k-nearest neighbor searches. It allows to pass a set of predicates. Values will be returned only if all predicates are met.

Spatial predicates may be generated by one of the functions listed below:
boost::geometry::index::contains(),
boost::geometry::index::covered_by(),
boost::geometry::index::covers(),
boost::geometry::index::disjoint(),
boost::geometry::index::intersects(),
boost::geometry::index::overlaps(),
boost::geometry::index::within(),
It is possible to negate spatial predicates:
! boost::geometry::index::contains(),
! boost::geometry::index::covered_by(),
! boost::geometry::index::covers(),
! boost::geometry::index::disjoint(),
! boost::geometry::index::intersects(),
! boost::geometry::index::overlaps(),
! boost::geometry::index::within()
Satisfies predicate

This is a special kind of predicate which allows to pass a user-defined function or function object which checks if Value should be returned by the query. It's generated by:
boost::geometry::index::satisfies().
Nearest predicate

If the nearest predicate is passed a k-nearest neighbor search will be performed. This query will result in returning k values to the output iterator. Only one nearest predicate may be passed to the query. It may be generated by:
boost::geometry::index::nearest().
Connecting predicates
Predicates may be passed together connected with operator&&().

simplesect.title: Throws
simplesect.para: If Value copy constructor or copy assignment throws.
Only one nearest() perdicate may be passed to the query. Passing more of them results in compile-time error.

parameterdescription.para: The output iterator, e.g. generated by std::back_inserter().

simplesect.para: The number of values found.

memberdef.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::const_query_iterator
memberdef.definition: rtree<Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator>::const_query_iterator boost::geometry::index::qbegin
memberdef.argsstring: (rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > const &tree, Predicates const &predicates)
memberdef.name: qbegin

param.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > const &

briefdescription.para: Returns the query iterator pointing at the begin of the query range.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns the iterator which may be used to perform iterative queries. For the information about the predicates which may be passed to this method see query().

simplesect.title: Iterator category
simplesect.para: ForwardIterator

simplesect.title: Throws
simplesect.para: If predicates copy throws. If allocation throws.
The modification of the rtree may invalidate the iterators.
The iterator pointing at the begin of the query range.

memberdef.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::const_query_iterator
memberdef.definition: rtree<Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator>::const_query_iterator boost::geometry::index::qend

memberdef.name: qend

param.type: rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator > const &

briefdescription.para: Returns the query iterator pointing at the end of the query range.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns the iterator which may be used to check if the query has ended.

simplesect.title: Iterator category
simplesect.para: ForwardIterator

simplesect.title: Throws
simplesect.para: Nothing
The modification of the rtree may invalidate the iterators.
The iterator pointing at the end of the query range.

simplesect.para: ForwardIterator
